m_DescList: Sometimes we aren't sure whether a string contains the target subexpression.
We can wrap potentially existing content with <color=#05C3BA>( )</color> and add <color=#FF68DD>?</color> to indicate that the content may appear 0 or 1 times.

For example, using <color=#AB2800>a</color><color=#05C3BA>(</color><color=#AB2800>b</color><color=#05C3BA>)</color><color=#FF68DD>?</color><color=#AB2800>c</color> to match <color=#3c3cff>abcac</color> yields:
For instance, a landline number may or may not have an area code prefix.
In these examples, 010 is the area code prefix.
When using <color=#05C3BA>( </color><color=#AB2800>010- </color><color=#05C3BA>)</color><color=#FF68DD>?</color><color=#3173FF>\d</color><color=#FF68DD>+</color> to match the above cases:
